question: Hi,I have been experiencing some very severe symptoms the last 5 months and I think it might be thyroid related.  There are several people my family with thyroid problems including immediate.  The most debilitating symptoms I am experiencing are tingling, burning, numbness all my arms and legs.  Also my metabolism seems to be very out of balance as I cannot go more than 2-3 hours without eating carbohydrates or the symptoms get worse.  I had my TSH done and it was 2.73 but they did not check T3 and T4.  I had diabetes tests done as well and they all came back normal.  I did for quite a while crash diet and use stimulants to lose weight so I am not sure if something/s got knocked way out of balance.  Thanks for any help or suggestions.
title: Thyroid problem?
